intro: Hieracium cezycola, commonly known as the Ceylon hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of many small florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along forest margins, thriving in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in clusters. Hieracium cezycola is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
